title: have some problems with the new TB 115 main display.
content: hi all, 115 changed some stuff on the main display and I'm not able to fix it or understand why. in the screenshot the "quick filter" smaller button is not needed or can be moved down as there is another one on the main toolbar (orange arrow) while the messages display toggle is not really needed as I don't think anyone use it daily. the yellow lines show a whole unused column not needed at all (and I don't really need to know the exact number of messages in a folder, or have it consume a whole column...). the green circle around the messages is because I can't seem to make the main display have bigger fonts. it's a messy display like that. how can I fix that? thanks :)
creator: arch.yossi

title: Attached email
content:
Good morning, the new Supernova version has a strange behavior: if I open a message from an .eml file (on the filesystem) and this message contains an attachment which is another .eml file, this is not opened by double clicking but must be saved as .eml file on the filesystem to be able to open it. All of this does not happen if the message is opened from the account dashboard. Thanks for the help

Buongiorno, la nuova versione Supernova ha uno strano comportamento: se io apro un messaggio da un un file .eml (sul filesystem) e questo messaggio continene un allegato che è un altro file .eml, questo non viene aperto attraverso il doppio click ma occorre salvarlo come file .eml sul filesystemper poterlo aprire. Tutto qusto non capita se il messaggio viene aperto dal dashboard dell'account. Grazie dell'aiuto
creator: processor

Másfél éve használom a rendszert, 3 postafiók van beállítva, ebből kettő komoly levélforgalmat bonyolít, és mindig a legrosszabkor jön, ha újra be kell állítanom ezeket a fiókokat egy újraindítás után. A levelek nem vesznek el, de ez roppant bosszantó! Mi lehet rá a megoldás?

title: Open message in conversation feature gone in Thunderbird 115
content: Hello A feature I used to use frequently is gone now since updating to Thunderbird 115. That was the ability, when in a message, to click on 'More' top right and then 'open message in conversation' or something like that - to see all exchanges with a particular sender. I've searched the help database and found people had similar problems - some of the answers seem to be about large accounts - but I'm just not clear on what might be the cause in my case. Advice welcome. Thanks Siobhán

title: Egyesített mappák / (!csak a )Beérkezett üzenetek mappa üres. (Nem tölti be különböző levelező fiókok beérkezett üzenetek mappáit
content:
Több fiókot kezelő, korábban jól működő Thunderbird a legutóbbi megújulás óta (aktuálisan 115.4.1 (64) verzió) az Egyesített mappák / Beérkezett üzenetek mappa teljesen üres, nem tölti be a különböző fiókok beérkezett üzenetek mappáit, ezáltal a leveleket sem. A többi gyűjtőmappa (Piszkozatok, Elküldött, stb) rendben működik.

Megkerülő megoldásként a kedvencek mappába összegyűjtöttem a beérkező levelek fiókjait ill Beérkezett mappáit, de a megoldás nem elegáns

Milyen beállítás szükséges?
creator: jakylaszlo

title: Thunderbird stops the Microsoft Windows key from working

title: Folder will not open
content:
My Thunderbird recently automatically updated to the latest version. One of my sub-folders, containing several important emails is no longer available and cannot be seen in Thunderbird when it is open and working. I can find it by doing various searched in the C: drive, and it now comes in two formats, "[folder name] with no suffix, and [folder name] .msf. I have tried to open both of these and get the following consistent message: "Thunderbird is already running, but is not responding. The old Thunderbird process must be closed to open a new window". I have tried closing Thunderbird - no change. I have tried turning the computer off and back on - no change. One of the locations given for the C:drive reads "C:/Users/Public/Documents/qv652mnd.default/Mail/Local Folders/ followed by the name of the main folder where I keep the missing sub-folder.sbd" Any idea what is going on?

I am not technologically savvy and would appreciate advice in simple terminology.

Many thanks.

Veronica
creator: vhl1

title: Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password.
content:
After installing Thunderbird I want to set up my existing email address (gmail)

I set my name, email address, password (also check if it's the right one and it is). Then try to config IMAP (imap.gmail.com with port 143 for STARTTLS and OAuth2) and STMP (smtp.gmail.com with port 587for STARTTLS and OAuth2), in both IMAP and STMP I tried also SSL/TLS (993 imap /465stmp) and various of Auth method. The result is that I am unable to Done it (probably some wrong settings in STMP) I tried everything and don't know what to do.

could you help me?

title: Once again, Thunderbird isn't receiving SMS messages from my Samsung phone (sent via Samsung Messages).
content:
It's very like my old problem from two years ago (see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1346774), except I can't get Next SMS to work without referring to Google (which I've been trying for years to avoid doing -- and haven't needed since my previous report).

I can send SMS messages from my phone to my sisters, and receive messages from them -- and am testing with other folks. And I can send from my PC to both of the aliases that the phone sends from: [cell-phone number]@vtext.com for plain text messages and [cell-phone number@mypixmessages.com for messages with attachments. But nothing has gone through from my phone to my PC since just before 1am (EDT/GMT -4) on Monday the 23rd. No error messages received on either end, so no help of that kind.

I've consulted Samsung tech support, but they insist there haven't been any updates on that end which could have caused the problem, and suggest that I have to contact folks on this end. So that's what I'm doing.

Please HELP!

title: Need horizontal lines between message headers, disappeared with v115
content:
Hi, I've had this problem two other times with various upgrades, where my setting no longer works. I need horizontal lines between message headers in all folders. My eyes need the lines to be able to scan across and not get lost. I am using TB v115.3.3 on Windows 11 Home.

Here is an old version of my problem: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1277758

Here is the full content of my userChrome.css file that is located here: C:\Users\Victoria\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\hid4pw25.default\chrome

@namespace url(http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul);

/* Add bottom border to thread pane (message list) */

  1. threadTree treechildren::-moz-tree-row { 
 border-bottom: 1px solid grey !important;

}

Thank you for any help.

--Victoria
creator: Victoria-nola

title: Can't send email via hotmail server
content:
After the most recent update, Thunderbird will not allow me to connect to the hotmail SMTP server to send email. I get a message from Microsoft that "My browser is currently set to block cookies...." This makes no sense to me. No browser involved in talking to a server as a client. All my other email servers work just fine. The image attached shows the full message. If I try and get email from my hotmail account with POP3, it just times out with no message.

Thanks for any help you can provide. I'm desperate! Bert ... a very long time Thunderbird user.
creator: bert.buckley

title: Folder issue with Thunderbird 115.4.1
content: Ever since I installed Thunderbird 115.4.1 (32-bit), I am having issues with folders displaying the number of unread messages. The "Local Folders" heading will show the total number of folders. However some of the folders may/may not display the number of unread messages. In other words, a folder under local folders may contain several sub folders. The main folder under "Local Folders" does not always display the number of unread messages in a folder, but does display them in the subfolder. Since it does not display the number of unread messages on the main folder listed under "Local Folders," I have no idea which subfolder contains the unread messages. I usually have to do a search for the messages for the current date to find which subfolder actually contains unread messages. This was never an issue with previous versions.

title: Problems Configuring Folders with Global Inbox
content:
I'm giving Thunderbird a try because I'm unhappy with spam filters and rules not working in Outlook. I am tired of checking all my spam every day, to be sure that a wanted email is placed there. I want my T-BIrd to receive all spam, and use T-BIrd's rules to then firmly isolate, or even delete, specific spam that I receive.

I've set up four email accounts, using a Global Inbox, so everything is together. While I had been using IMAP with Outlook, I understand I need to use Pop3 for this to work with Thunderbird, so I did that. But....

I am getting some emails with Thunderbird, but not all, even those addressed to me. Will leaving Outlook open during this transition period prevent T-Bird from working properly? Likewise, can gmail.com be open when trying to debug messages? I just sent myself a gmail message, which was received in Outlook, but not in T-Bird (and I couldn't find it in Gmail either, which is /really/ confusing).

Oh, shoot, I tried sending mail using my Gmail account from Thunderbird, and it failed. I went to look up Server settings for Gmail with T-Bird, and the article said I'd have to use IMAP, which I cannot use if I want to have the Global Inbox. So, is use of T-Bird dead for me, if I require/desire a Global inbox?

Of the emails I've received so far, only one is marked by T-Bird as Junk, which I can identify by the red color, and when I click on it, I have a "Not Junk" button. But there is no Junk folder, which is where I thought it would be.
creator: rraisley
